title: Drawing, "Textile Design:  Alpenkoenig [King of the Alps]", designed 1916–18
medium: Brush and gouache, graphite on paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink on mount, lower right beneath 1988-62-1300: Dessin "Alpen König"; inscribed in pen and black ink, below 1988-62-344: Dessin "Anilin"; inscribed in blue crayon on mount, upper right corner: 84; stamped in red on mount, lower right corner: WIENER/WERK/STÄTTE.
creditline: Museum purchase from Smithsonian Collections Acquisition and Decorative Arts Association Acquisition Funds
description: Stylized interlacing sawgs with branches growing from curled sections in gold and green on white background.

exhibitions.title: Glass of the Avant-Garde: From Vienna Secession to Bauhaus

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Textile Design:  Alpenkoenig [King of the Alps]", designed 1916–18.
designed 1916–18. Brush and gouache, graphite on paper. Museum purchase from Smithsonian Collections Acquisition and Decorative Arts Association Acquisition Funds. 1988-62-1294.
